head.title: Metadata Redaction From {{EXT}} Document in {{ProgLang}}
head.description: Easily search, replace, remove or edit metadata of various document types by applying filters to choose specific metadata properties using GroupDocs.Redactions API for {{ProgLang}}.

header.title: Metadata Redaction From {{EXT}} Document in {{ProgLang}}
header.description: Easily search, replace, remove or edit metadata of various document types by applying filters to choose specific metadata properties using GroupDocs.Redactions API for {{ProgLang}}.

about.title: Getting Started with Metadata Redaction
about.h1: Sometimes you need to completely delete unwanted metadata fields or you may want to update their values. There is also hidden data associated with files that can be viewed using various tools and techniques. There are many situations where you do not want this data to be accessible to anyone. Redaction means the removal of unwanted or confidential information from various documents. All file formats including PDF, DOC, DOCX, PPT, PPTX, XLS, XLSX and others have specific metadata structures. Metadata properties include author name, category, company name, comments, creation time and last updated etc. With the GroupDocs.Redaction API you can apply metadata redaction to any of these metadata fields. You can change or delete them by filtering the metadata you want. In this guide we will explain how you can apply metadata redaction from {{EXT}} document in {{ProgLang}}.

content_left.step_1: Following code allows you to search and redact sensitive data from a {{EXT}} document. You can set scope for redaction by setting filter, e.g. to MetadataFilter.Createdtime. It will leave the regular expressions matches undone in all metadata items, except "Createdtime" property:

content_right.step_1: Create an instance of [Redactor](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/java/com.groupdocs.redaction/Redactor) class & upload {{EXT}} file
content_right.step_2: Create an instance of [MetadataSearchRedaction](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/java/com.groupdocs.redaction.redactions/MetadataSearchRedaction) class to find and replace sensitive data from document's metadata
content_right.step_3: Set scope for redaction by setting filter, e.g. Use MetadataFilters.Createdtime in below code
content_right.step_4: Call save method with object of [MetadataSearchRedaction](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/java/com.groupdocs.redaction.redactions/MetadataSearchRedaction)

content_left.step_1: You can replace all or specific metadata in the document with empty (blank or minimal) values using EraseMetadataRedaction class. Following code shows how you can filter and then remove a metadata property from a {{EXT}} document.The example below blanks out all properties of the document:

content_right.step_1: Create an instance of [Redactor](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/java/com.groupdocs.redaction/Redactor) class & upload {{EXT}} file
content_right.step_2: Create an instance of [MetadataSearchRedaction](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/java/com.groupdocs.redaction.redactions/MetadataSearchRedaction) class to remove metadata of the document
content_right.step_3: Set scope for redaction by setting filter, e.g. Replace MetadataFilter.All with MetadataFilter.Createdtime in below code
content_right.step_4: Call save method with object of [MetadataSearchRedaction](https://apireference.groupdocs.com/redaction/java/com.groupdocs.redaction.redactions/MetadataSearchRedaction)

content_left.description: GroupDocs.Redaction for Java APIs are supported on all major platforms and operating systems. For complete system requirements guide, please visit [system requirements](https://docs.groupdocs.com/redaction/java/system-requirements) Before executing the code below, please make sure that you have the following prerequisites installled on your system:
content_left.step_1: Operating Systems: Microsoft Windows, Linux, MacOS
content_left.step_2: Development Environment: NetBeans, Intellij IDEA, Eclipse etc
content_left.step_3: Java Runtime Environment: J2SE 6.0 and above
content_left.step_4: Get the latest version of GroupDocs.Redaction for Java from [Maven](https://repository.groupdocs.com/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/repo/com/groupdocs/groupdocs-redaction)

content_right.step_1: Allow users to add custom document formats and types of redactions
content_right.step_2: No additional software is required to remove sensitive information
content_right.step_3: Ability to set page range rendering document as PDF
content_right.step_4: Easy way to redact different types of metadata: author name, version, title, subject, description and many more
content_right.step_5: Document information extraction - file type, page count etc.
